author: Der_Das
title: Shiny contents is not just brick-bling.
review:
Yes, this is not just to dazzle us. The die could be used in games to distinguish it from the standard dice and allow special rules for it. As a budding game designer, this holds interesting possibilities for me.

 

A must have for me, although the price is on the high end of my scale. Bling lovers could wait for the keychain variant - if it ever will be sold. ;)

 

Add. info:

Actually, the contents is not identical to '2853588-1: Promo Goldener Würfel (Golden dice)'. This set contains an actual 1-pip tile whereas the former does not. In short, this set has 8pcs, the other edition has 7pcs.

author: Purno
title: Nice pretty bouncy dice
review:
I tried ordering this set at Lego, it was unavailable as set, but I could order the separate parts for a total of €6,17 in the Netherlands including shipping at Lego Direct. To be honest, I expected it to be more expensive.

Box/Instructions

I received my parts in a transparent bag with a 4+ age indication. No instructions were present, but I was able to build the dice without.

Parts

8 parts total.

The gold dice isn't entirely one color, but shows some minor color variations.

Oddly, the tile with 1 dot featured a slightly smaller dot than the dots on the other tiles.

I ordered this dice since I didn't found a complete dice in any of the games. To get a full dice you'd need to buy at least 2 different games. And this seemed the only way to get a gold dice, which can offer unique gameplay rules.

Minifigures

None

The build

As easy as it seems, it was. Since the dice is made of rubber, the tiles can be taken off relatively easy with your nails.

The completed model

Since the dice is made of some sort of rubber, it bounces more than it rolls. The dice can bounce in any direction. On a flat surface, it seems like there's a fraction of a millimeter between the tile and the surface, so the tile doesn't touch the surface.

Summary

Considering the other ways to get a complete dice in a color that doesn't seem obtainable in another way, I'd say it's worth the money.

author: Andhe
title: It's a die, but in gold.
review:
The lego games die, but in gold.

Has only been available in two polybags, both as promotional giveaways. This one and http://brickset.com/detail/?Set=2853588-1.

This version has tiles with numbered dots 1-6 and a printed LEGO logo tile. Which is nice.

Potential uses:
- As a 'power die' in a game.
- If it's their birthday someone could be allowed to use the golden die.
- Throw it at the wall and see if you can catch it when it bounces.

If you like Lego games, then this is a fun item to have.
